IDAMetadataDescriptorVersion.description: Version of the metadata descriptor. Must be 1.

name.description: The name will be used to identify the plugin and also generate a namespace name for it if necessary (e.g., an IDAPython plugin). The namespace name is generated by converting all non alphanumeric characters of the plugin name to underscores (_) and prepending __plugins__ to it. For example "my plugin" would become __plugins__my_plugin.

entryPoint.description: The filename of the "main" file for the plugin. It should be stored in the same directory as its ida-plugin.json file. If the entryPoint has no file extension, IDA will assume it is a native plugin and append the appropriate file extension for dynamic shared objects for the host platform (.dll, .so, .dylib). For IDAPython plugins, this should typically be a .py file (e.g., my-first-plugin.py).

categories.description: At least one category for discoverability.

logoPath.description: Include an image to visually represent your plugin on its page at plugins.hex-rays.com. This should be a relative path to an image file within your pluginâ€™s repository. The recommended aspect ratio for the image is 16:9.

idaVersions.description: List of specific IDA versions that your plugin supports. Each version must be declared explicitly.
